item.title: As dense fog persists, IMD issues ‘orange’ alert across Delhi-NCR; routes to airport, highways likely to be affected - The Indian Express
item.description:
IMD Issues Orange Alert for Dense Fog Across Delhi-NCR

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

As Delhi woke up to thick fog, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued an 'orange' alert impacting travel across the national capital region.

  • The IMD warned of dense to very dense fog affecting routes to the airport, railway stations, and highways.
  • Low visibility of 50 meters recorded at Indira Gandhi International Airport; no significant disruptions in flight operations.
  • COM suggested the use of fog lights for vehicles and to remain in contact with transport authorities.
  • The forecast predicts temperatures ranging from 6 to 19 degrees Celsius for the upcoming days.
  • Air quality improved from 'very poor' to 'poor' at 278 AQI on Sunday.
  • Previous fog conditions caused delays in flights and trains.
“The last time visibility dropped to zero in Delhi was between January 2 and 3 for nine consecutive hours.”

Due to the ongoing fog, commuters are advised to take precautions and stay updated on travel conditions.

item.title: California wildfires live updates: Death toll rises to 24, officials prepare for a ‘particularly dangerous situation’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
California Wildfires Update: Death Toll Reaches 24 Amid Dangerous Conditions

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The wildfires in California's Los Angeles County have led to a rising death toll of 24, with mandatory evacuation orders being lifted in several parts as officials brace for worsening weather conditions.

  • Twenty-four fatalities reported, with many more missing.
  • Over 12,000 structures have been damaged or destroyed.
  • Dangerous dry winds are expected to exacerbate the situation.
  • Evacuation orders in place for over 200,000 residents.
  • Governor Gavin Newsom has announced a “rebuilding plan” for affected areas.
“The fires are still raging in L.A. The incompetent pols have no idea how to put them out.” - Donald Trump

The fires represent one of the worst wildfire starts to a year for California, affecting countless lives and structures across the region.

item.title: Amazon Great Republic Day Sale: iPhone 15, Realme GT 7 Pro, and more phones on discounts - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Amazon Great Republic Day Sale 2025: Check out the list of top 5 discounted smartphones including iPhone 15, Realme GT 7 Pro, and others.

Date: Jan 13, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Amazon has launched its Great Republic Day Sale for 2025, offering significant discounts on various smartphones including popular models like the iPhone 15 and Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra.

  • iPhone 15 price dropped from ₹69,990 to ₹56,999.
  • Realme GT 7 Pro available for ₹59,998, down from ₹69,999.
  • iQOO 12 now priced at ₹45,999, previously ₹59,999.
  • Vivo X200 Pro discounted to ₹94,999 from ₹1,01,999.
  • Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra now ₹71,999 with a 52% discount from ₹1,49,999.
“Buyers can avail bank and exchange offers to further reduce prices.”

This sale provides a great opportunity for buyers looking to upgrade their smartphones at discounted rates.

item.title: Severe winds return: Los Angeles wildfire death toll climbs to 24, 'fire tornado' spotted - The Times of India
item.description:
Severe Winds Return: Los Angeles Wildfire Death Toll Climbs to 24, 'Fire Tornado' Spotted

Publication Date: [Not specified]; Source: [Not specified]

Firefighters are battling devastating wildfires in Los Angeles that have claimed 24 lives and destroyed thousands of homes. Governor Gavin Newsom warns this could be the most severe natural disaster in American history due to its extensive damage.

  • Over 40,000 acres have burned, surpassing San Francisco's size.
  • More than 12,000 structures destroyed, with around 150,000 residents evacuated.
  • Weather conditions have worsened with red flag warnings and winds up to 70 mph.
  • A fire tornado was reported, adding to the severity of the situation.
  • The estimated economic impact could reach between $135 billion and $150 billion.
Governor Gavin Newsom: "I think it will be in terms of just the costs associated with it, in terms of the scale and scope."

The situation remains critical, with authorities raising concerns over looting amidst the disaster, while additional resources are mobilized to combat the fires.

item.title: Z-Morh tunnel: Security heightened in Kashmir as PM Modi visits today to inaugurate ‘engineering marvel’ | Details - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Security Heightened in Kashmir for PM Modi's Inauguration of Z-Morh Tunnel

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the Z-Morh tunnel in Jammu and Kashmir, with extensive security measures in place for the event.

  • PM Modi will inaugurate the strategically important Z-Morh tunnel planned to boost connectivity to Ladakh.
  • Security arrangements include the deployment of police, paramilitary forces, and the Army.
  • The Z-Morh tunnel is a 6.5-km long project estimated to cost ₹2,400 crore and is vital for year-round access to the Ladakh region.
  • Authorities temporarily closed the Srinagar-Leh national highway for security reasons during the inauguration.
  • The tunnel is expected to enhance tourism and facilitate military access.
“The Sonamarg Tunnel in Jammu and Kashmir is a game-changer for the region, offering more than just a connection between Gagangir and Sonamarg.” - NHIDCL

The inauguration is seen as a significant step in enhancing the infrastructure and security of the region.

item.title: IPL 2025 Schedule: Season to begin on March 21 in Kolkata, final set for May 25 - The Times of India
item.description:
IPL 2025 Schedule: Season to begin on March 21 in Kolkata, final set for May 25

Date: January 12, 2025
Source: Times of India

The 18th season of the Indian Premier League (IPL) will begin on March 21, 2025, in Kolkata's Eden Gardens, with the final taking place on May 25, 2025.

  • The season starts a week later than previously announced.
  • The change in schedule is likely due to scheduling conflicts with the Champions Trophy final on March 9, although broadcasters have denied making a request for these adjustments.
  • Kolkata Knight Riders will host both the opener and the final.
  • Sunrisers Hyderabad will host two playoff games.
  • The complete schedule is expected to be released soon following BCCI meetings.
“The BCCI is expected to release the complete schedule shortly,” said BCCI vice-president Rajiv Shukla.

Overall, the IPL 2025 season promises exciting matches with a new revised schedule that avoids overlap with other major cricket events.

item.title: 'Canada Is Not For Sale': Trudeau's Former Ally Jagmeet Singh Warns Trump Over Tariff Threat - News18
item.description:
Jagmeet Singh Warns Trump: 'Canada Is Not For Sale'

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: News18

Jagmeet Singh, leader of the New Democratic Party, issued a warning to US President-elect Donald Trump regarding tariff threats and Canadian sovereignty.

  • Singh emphasized that Canada is not for sale and called for retaliatory tariffs against the US if Trump imposes his proposed tariffs.
  • He stated that Canadians are proud people willing to fight to protect their country.
  • Canadian officials are preparing to discuss potential retaliatory measures against US tariffs.
  • The Canadian government is considering tariffs on various US products if Trump proceeds with his plans.
“If Donald Trump thinks he can pick a fight with us, there will be a price to pay,” said Jagmeet Singh.

This situation highlights the tension between Canada and the US following Trump’s tariff threats and proposals for economic control over Canada.

item.title: Stocks to watch, January 13: Indus Towers, DMart, HCL Technologies, Just Dial, Delta Corp, Den Networks, Himadri Speciality Chemical, and more - Upstox
item.description:
Stocks to Watch, January 13: Indus Towers, DMart, HCL Technologies, Just Dial, Delta Corp, Den Networks, Himadri Speciality Chemical, and more

Date: January 13, 2025   Source: Market News

The domestic equity market is expected to open in negative territory today, with key companies reporting earnings and market actions being of particular interest.

  • HCL Technologies: Set to announce Q3 FY25 results today, with expectations for strong growth.
  • Avenue Supermarts: Reported a 4.8% rise in consolidated net profit to ₹723.54 crore for Q3 FY25.
  • Just Dial: Reported a 42.7% increase in net profit to ₹131.31 crore for Q3 FY25.
  • Indus Towers: Vodafone sold its entire stake for ₹2,800 crore.
  • Other Earnings: 13 companies, including Delta Corp and Den Networks, scheduled to announce financial results today.
“We continue to see the increased intensity in discounting in the FMCG category.” - Neville Noronha, CEO of Avenue Supermarts

This day's stock performances could signal broader trends in the market as quarterly results are released across various sectors.

item.title: Nifty 50, Sensex today: What to expect from Indian stock market in trade on January 13 - Mint
item.description:
Nifty 50 and Sensex Outlook for Indian Stock Market on January 13

Publication Date: January 13 | Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market is expected to open lower, influenced by weak global cues, with the Nifty 50 likely facing further downside pressure.

  • Sensex closed down 241.30 points, and Nifty 50 fell by 95 points.
  • Gift Nifty indicates a gap-down start with a trading level around 23,330.
  • A bearish sentiment prevails with potential support noted at 23,000.
“The bearish pressure continues to intensify…” – Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities.

This trend of market decline highlights the presence of selling pressure amid weak momentum. Traders should monitor the resistance levels while managing risks accordingly.

item.title: Huge Pat Cummins Surprise As Australia Announce ICC Champions Trophy Squad - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Huge Pat Cummins Surprise As Australia Announce ICC Champions Trophy Squad

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 Source: NDTV

Pat Cummins returns to Australia’s ICC Champions Trophy squad after skipping the Sri Lanka Test tour for the birth of his second child, despite carrying a knee injury. Injured paceman Josh Hazlewood is also included in the squad.

  • Pat Cummins leads the 15-man squad for the ICC Champions Trophy.
  • Josh Hazlewood returns to the team after overcoming injuries.
  • Jake Fraser-McGurk was dropped due to poor form.
  • The tournament will take place from February 19 to March 9 in Pakistan and the UAE.
AUSTRALIA SQUAD FOR CHAMPIONS TROPHY 2025: Cummins (C), Carey, Ellis, Hardie, Hazlewood, Head, Inglis, Labuschagne, Marsh, Maxwell, Short, Smith, Starc, Stoinis, Zampa.

This squad is seen as balanced and experienced, with many players having participated in recent international matches.

item.title: Oil hits more than 3-month high as US sanctions hit Russia exports - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Oil hits more than 3-month high as US sanctions hit Russia exports

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Oil prices have risen to their highest level in over three months due to new US sanctions targeting Russian oil exports, affecting key importers like China and India.

  • The US Treasury imposed sanctions on Russian oil producers Gazprom Neft and Surgutneftegas, as well as 183 vessels shipping Russian oil.
  • Brent crude futures reached $81.11 a barrel and peaked at $81.44, the highest since August 27.
  • US West Texas Intermediate crude rose to $77.97 a barrel after a high of $78.32.
  • The sanctions aim to cut revenue that funds Russia's war efforts in Ukraine.
"Brent crude futures climbed $1.35, or 1.69%, to $81.11 a barrel by 2339 GMT after hitting an intraday high of $81.44."

This escalation in oil prices highlights the impact of geopolitical tensions and ongoing sanctions on global markets.

item.title: Weight Loss Story: This 68-year-old defeated diabetes and lost 11 Kg in 6 months through low-carb diet - The Times of India
item.description:
Weight Loss Story: This 68-year-old defeated diabetes and lost 11 Kg in 6 months through low-carb diet

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Bharat Shah, a 68-year-old retiree, transformed his health by losing 11 kg and reversing his diabetes in just six months through a low-carb diet and exercise.

  • Shah reduced his BMI from 27 to 23 and stopped long-term medications for diabetes and blood pressure.
  • The motivation to reverse diabetes led him to restructure his health approach.
  • He followed a very low-carb diet, limiting carbs to 20 grams per day initially, then 50 grams.
  • Engaged in yoga and walking regularly to support his fitness.
  • His HbA1C levels dropped from 6.6 to 5.6, marking a complete reversal of diabetes.
“My diabetes medication dose had increased, and I had to start taking medication for BP.”

This inspiring story emphasizes that age should not deter individuals from pursuing health transformations and the importance of motivation and mindful dietary choices for lasting health improvements.

item.title: Game Changer box office collection Day 3: Ram Charan starrer sees collections fall under Rs 20 crore; mis - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Game Changer box office collection Day 3: Ram Charan starrer sees collections fall under Rs 20 crore; misses Rs 100 crore mark on debut weekend

Publication Date: Unknown Source: Times of India

The much-anticipated Ram Charan starrer Game Changer witnessed a disappointing start to its debut weekend, failing to cross the Rs 100 crore mark as it experienced a sharp decline in box office collections.

  • The film earned an estimated Rs 17 crore net on Day 3.
  • It opened strongly at Rs 51 crore but dropped to Rs 21.6 crore on Day 2.
  • Total domestic collection for the debut weekend is around Rs 89.6 crore.
  • The Telugu version is the strongest performer with an estimated total of Rs 61.75 crore.
  • Competition from films like 'Fateh' and 'Pushpa' affected its performance.
  • In North America, it earned only US $ 1.6 million (Rs 14.25 crore) over the weekend.
  • The Telangana government revoked orders for increased ticket prices, impacting box office potential.
“It would take a serious change for fortune for the film to recover its breakeven amount which has been pegged at US $4.5 million.”

With no major releases ahead, all eyes are on the film's performance on its first Monday as it tries to recover from a steep decline in collections.

item.title: Inventing Anna actor Julia Garner interview: ‘Nothing’s ever really easy if you want it to be good' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Julia Garner Discusses Her Role in Wolf Man and the Challenges of Horror Films

Publication Date: N/A Source: Hindustan Times

In an interview with Hindustan Times, Julia Garner opens up about her transition from the hit Netflix series Inventing Anna to starring in the upcoming film Wolf Man, highlighting the unique experiences and challenges of horror filmmaking.

  • Garner reflects on her journey from playing a scam artist to starring in a traditional monster movie.
  • She describes Wolf Man as a film meant for the big screen, emphasizing the cinematic experience.
  • Garner's character, Charlotte, experiences emotional complexity as her husband transforms into a werewolf.
  • The preparation involved interviewing working mothers to portray Charlotte's struggles authentically.
  • Garner mentions the physical demands of the role, stating that it involved significantly more running than any previous projects.
“Nothing's ever really easy if you want it to be good. Usually, the simplest things are the hardest.” – Julia Garner

The film Wolf Man is not just a horror movie; it serves as a narrative about relationships, loss, and the fight for survival against overwhelming odds.

item.title: Uttarakhand: 6 dead, 22 injured as bus falls into gorge in Pauri Garhwal - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Uttarakhand: 6 dead, 22 injured as bus falls into gorge in Pauri Garhwal

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A tragic bus accident occurred in the Pauri Garhwal district, resulting in the deaths of six individuals and injuries to 22 others. The bus fell into a 100 meters deep gorge while traveling from Pauri to Dahalchauri.

  • The bus had 28 passengers on board.
  • Five people were confirmed dead at the scene.
  • The accident site is located near Dahalchauri.
  • Rescue operations were supported by local residents.
  • Eight injured passengers were in critical condition and referred to higher medical facilities.
  • Pauri District Magistrate Ashish Chauhan oversaw the rescue efforts.
  • Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed condolences and concern for the injured.
“The causes of the accident will be investigated,” stated Pauri District Magistrate Ashish Chauhan.

The community response and the prompt action by authorities highlight the urgent need for safety measures in the region to prevent such tragedies in the future.

item.title: In challenge to Amit Shah, Kejriwal says won’t contest Delhi polls if Centre assures houses for all slum-dwellers in court - The Indian Express
item.description:
Kejriwal Challenges Amit Shah on Slum Rehabilitation Ahead of Delhi Elections

Publication Date: Sunday; Source: Various News Outlets

In a bold move, AAP Chief Arvind Kejriwal declared he would not contest the upcoming Delhi elections if the BJP commits to rehabilitating displaced slum-dwellers within 24 hours of eviction.

  • Kejriwal called for the withdrawal of cases against slum demolitions.
  • He accused the BJP of exploiting slum-dwellers for electoral gain.
  • The AAP leader emphasized the need for immediate housing solutions for the displaced.
Kejriwal: "Withdraw all the cases... and submit an affidavit in court that you will give houses to all those people... I will not contest the elections."

This statement follows the BJP's rhetoric linking slum-removal to urban improvement.

In conclusion, Kejriwal's challenge puts pressure on the BJP to address slum rehabilitation before the elections, raising significant concerns about housing security in Delhi.

item.title: Scorpio Daily Horoscope Today, Jan 13, 2025 predicts new avenues for growth - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Scorpio Daily Horoscope Today, Jan 13, 2025 predicts new avenues for growth

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Today offers opportunities for personal growth, relationship insights, career advancements, financial planning, and health improvements for Scorpio.

  • In relationships, focus on nurturing connections and strengthening emotional bonds.
  • Career-wise, trust your instincts and collaborate with colleagues for success.
  • Financially, focus on planning and avoid impulsive purchases.
  • Health-wise, maintain physical and mental well-being with regular exercise and relaxation.
Scorpios may find themselves in a reflective mood, seeking deeper connections and understanding.

Today is a great time to build on strengths and seek new opportunities.

item.title: California wildfires live: 3 out of 6 active fires in Los Angeles 100% contained, Palisades continues to burn - Hindustan Times
item.description:
California Wildfires: Major Fires in Los Angeles Contained Amid Devastation

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The California wildfires have wreaked havoc, with at least 16 confirmed deaths and over 12,000 structures damaged. As of now, three of the six active fires in Los Angeles have been contained, but the Palisades fire continues to burn.

Key Points:
  • The Palisades Fire spread to an additional 1,000 acres, prompting ongoing firefighting efforts.
  • Evacuation orders affect approximately 153,000 residents, with many additional residents warned to prepare for evacuation.
  • Governor Gavin Newsom announced significant containment progress for several fires, with different percentages confirmed.
  • President Biden has been coordinating relief efforts and addressing state officials regarding the crisis.
  • International aid is on the way, with offers from Canada and Ukraine for firefighting assistance.
“The fires are still raging in L.A. This is one of the worst catastrophes in the history of our Country.” - Donald Trump

The situation remains critical with adverse weather predicted, and officials continue to emphasize the importance of safety and evacuation compliance.

item.title: 6 killed after bus plunges 100 metres into gorge in Uttarakhand - The Indian Express
item.description:
6 killed after bus plunges 100 metres into gorge in Uttarakhand

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Six people died and several were injured after a private bus fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand’s Pauri Garhwal district on Sunday evening. The bus was travelling with 28 passengers when it lost control and plunged into a gorge.

  • The incident occurred around 4.30 PM near Dehalchauri.
  • SDRF teams and police conducted rescue operations at the site.
  • Injured passengers were taken to the district hospital with some referred to a hospital in Srinagar.
  • The deceased were identified, including Sunita (25) and Prem (70).
Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami stated, “The deeply tragic news of the bus accident... has been received with great sorrow.”

This tragic event underscores the need for improved road safety measures in hilly areas.

item.title: Devajit Saikia Elected New BCCI Secretary, Replaces Jay Shah - News18
item.description:
Devajit Saikia Elected New BCCI Secretary, Replaces Jay Shah

Date: January 12, 2025, Source: News18

Devajit Saikia was elected unopposed as the new BCCI Secretary at a Special General Meeting in Mumbai, succeeding Jay Shah, who vacated the position after becoming ICC Chairman.

  • Devajit Saikia and Prabhtej Singh Bhatia were elected unopposed for the positions of Secretary and Treasurer, respectively.
  • Both candidates were the only ones to file nominations for the vacant posts.
  • Jay Shah left his position after his election as ICC Chairman last month.
  • Saikia had been performing the duties of Secretary in the interim.
  • The election was uncontested, eliminating the need for a polling process.
“The Two (02) Elective Posts of the Office Bearers – Secretary and Treasurer were Uncontested, and it was not necessary to conduct a Poll in respect of these Two (02) Posts,” stated electoral officer A K Joti.

In conclusion, Devajit Saikia’s election is a continuation of stable leadership in the BCCI following the recent changes in the organization's hierarchy.

item.title: Satellite mission will closely monitor changes on Earth's surface - Earth.com
item.description:
Satellite Mission Will Closely Monitor Changes on Earth's Surface

Publication Date: N/A

Source: N/A

The upcoming U.S.-India NISAR mission aims to enhance our understanding of Earth’s ongoing changes through advanced satellite technology.

  • The NISAR mission will launch in a few months, utilizing dual-band radar to observe various Earth features.
  • The L-band radar penetrates vegetation for larger features, while the S-band focuses on finer surface details.
  • NISAR will monitor glaciers, forests, and wetlands, providing critical data for climate change studies.
  • The mission reflects an international partnership between NASA and ISRO, emphasizing global cooperation.
  • Data generated by NISAR will be freely accessible, benefitting both scientists and decision-makers.
“The planet’s surfaces never stop changing – in some ways small and subtle, and in other ways monumental and sudden.” - Paul Rosen, NISAR Project Scientist at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory.

The NISAR mission represents a significant step in Earth observation technology, highlighting the importance of global collaboration in tackling environmental challenges.

item.title: Arsenal's week from hell leaves Mikel Arteta feeling the heat: Winners and losers as Gunners suffer FA Cup penalty heartbreak while Ruben Amorim's Man Utd again show improvements with Altay Bayindir the hero - Goal.com
item.description:
Arsenal's week from hell leaves Mikel Arteta feeling the heat

Publication Date: Not specified Source: GOAL

The most enticing tie of the FA Cup third round saw Arsenal suffer a heartbreaking penalty shootout defeat to Manchester United, raising concerns for Mikel Arteta as his team edges closer to another trophy-less season.

  • Manchester United edged past Arsenal after a dramatic 120 minutes of play.
  • United's goalkeeper Altay Bayindir was pivotal, saving a crucial penalty and performing strongly throughout the match.
  • Arsenal's Kai Havertz missed a penalty, highlighting the team's pressing need for a striker.
  • Mikel Arteta faces mounting pressure with his team's recent disappointing performance.
“Diogo Dalot must be hugely grateful to Altay Bayindir...”

The match not only affected the tournament standings but also cast doubt on Arsenal's season ambitions, as they seek to avoid a continuous cycle of disappointing results.
